definition: (derog.) inept advisor/a good-for-nothing adviser/one who offers bad advice

sentences.chinese: “头目”同样还会需要一名“军师”。

sentences.english: He is a member of the Board and adviser to the president.
sentences.chinese: 他现在是董事会成员，而且是主席的军师。

sentences.english: To, the military adviser just broke up with you, go to dry what?
sentences.chinese: 对了，军师刚刚和你们分手，去干什么了？

sentences.english: Marshal is killed counsellor and time will, unfortunate by another quiver of attack by a hidden enemy.
sentences.chinese: 元帅杀死军师和番将，不幸被另一番将暗箭射中。

sentences.english: I had orders from the director general to take this city.
sentences.chinese: 吾奉军师将令，已取城了。

sentences.english: Military councilor Wu Ying sent Shi Qian to attend to this matter.
sentences.chinese: 军师吴用派施七俺出席这个问题。

sentences.english: Arms of division of the iron army-invincible army in maneuver defeats accipitral hill, exposed 8 big questions.
sentences.chinese: 演习中铁军师兵败鹰山，暴露了八大问题。

definition: general/high-ranking military officer/to check or checkmate/fig. to embarrass/to challenge/to put sb on the spot
Chiangchun township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
(army) commander-in-chief (archaic)/provincial military governor and civil administrator during the early Republic of China era (1911-1949 AD)
(old) commanding general/commander-in-chief/(Qing dynasty) title for a governor-general (provincial military governor) 總督|总督[zong3 du1]
aids and advisors of top officials
Minister of War (official title in pre-Han Chinese states)/two-character surname Sima
